data.title: Calendar
data.text:
Kate Monk's Onomastikon

(Dictionary of Names)

Saints' Days - January

1 * Abel son of Adam Alalbero of Liege * Almachius/Telemachus d c400, Rome * Aodhan Basil the Great, Bishop of Caesarea, b329 son of St Basil the Elder * Basil, Bishop of Aix d475 Beoc/Beanus, Abbot in Donegal * Berka Zdislava, Blessed, (f) Litomerici, Bavaria d1252 Boannus * Clarus/Clare, Abbot of St Marcellus, Vienne, C7th Colman Connat, Abbess of Kildare Concord(i)us of Spoleto Cuan, Abbot Earnan * Edward the Confessor Elvan/Elvam, Bishop of London Eugendus * Fanchea/Fanchea, virgin, Rossory in Fermanagh Felix, Bishop of Bourges Fionntan Fulgentius of Ruspe Gregory Narianzen the Elder Henwyn of Llanilltud-Fawr, Abbot of Bardsey Island C6th Hugolinus of Gualdo Joseph M. Tommasi Justin of Chieti Maelrhys of Bardsey Island Magnus Martina BV Mary, Mother of God Medwin/Mydwyn, England Mochua, monk of Balla, Connaught Octave of the Nativity of Christ Odilo, Abbot of Cluny Oisin Peter of Arroa Telemachus Thirty Soldiers Martyred at Rome William, Abbot of St. Benigne at Dijon Zdislava Berka 2 Abel * Adelard/Adalar, Abbot of Corbie, gs of Charles Martel c752-827 Airaldus Antheros * Argeus, Narcissus + Marcellinus, d320 Tomi in Pontus * Aspasius, Bishop of Eauze, nr Auch d560 * Basil the Great, Bishop of Caesarea c330-79 + Gregory of Nazianzus Bentivoglia/o de Bonis * Blidulf/Bladulph, monk of Bobbio d c630 * Caspar del Bufalo, founder, 'Congregation of the Most Precious Blood' 1786-1836 Clarus, Abbot of Vienne Concordius Gerard Cagnoli Isadore of Antioch Isadore of Nitria Macarius of Alexandria (the Younger) C4th Mainchin Martinian of Milan 1000 Martyrs of Lichfield, under Diocletian Martyrs who Suffered in Rome Munchin/Mainchin, Bishop of Limerick C7th Odilo, Abbot of Cluny Seiriol of Wales Stephen Stephanie/Stephana Quinzani Vincencianus 3 Antherus, Pope * Aquilinus, Geminus, Eugene, Marcian, Quintus, Theodotus + Tryphon killed by Vandals c484 * Bertilia, foundress & hermitess, Maroeuil, France d c687 * Blitmund, monk of Bobbio & Abbot of Leucone d c660 Cillian Daniel Finlugh, Abbot in County Derry * Fintan/Fionntan, Abbot of Doon Florentius, Bishop of Vienne * Genevieve c422-500, France Gordius John, Apostle and Evangelist (Octave) Peter Balsam Pharaildis C7th Theopemptus 4 * Angela of Foligno, Blessed 1248-1309 Aodh Christiana * Elizabeth Ann Bayley Seton, 1st American-born canonized 1774-1821 Ferreolus, Bishop of Uzès Fianait Gregory, Bishop of Langres Holy Innocents, (Octave) Onouphrios of Gabrovo d1818 (Orth) Oringa Pharaildis Rigobert, Bishop of Reims Roger of Ellant Titus 5 * Apollinaris Syncletica (Dorotheus) hermitess near Rome * Charles of Sezze (John Charles Marchioni) monk near Rome C17th Ciara/Cyra of Kilkeary, d 679 Ciaran Convoyon Edward the Confessor Emily/Emiliana/Amelia Gerlac John Neumann Paula Rumon, Bishop of Devon (Translation to Tavistock) Severinus Sim(e)on Stylites the Elder, 390-459 Syncletica Talida of Antinoe Telesphorus, Pope Thomas, bishop (Octave) Vigil of Epiphany 6 * Anastasius, Syrmium, Pannonia, C4th * Andrew/Andre Bessett(e) 1845-1936 Diarmaid Diman, Bishop of Connor Edeyrn the Hermit Eigrad, bro Sampson of York * Epiphany/Twelfth Night (Caspar, Melchior + Balthazar, the Magi) Erminold of Prefenning Frederic of St. Vanne Gertrude van der Oosten Guarinus Hywin/Hywyn of Averdaron John de Ribera Mac(a)ra, virgin martyr, Rheims, C3rd Martyrs in Africa Melanius, bishop, of Rennes Merinus the Hermit * Muadhnat/Mona Peter, Abbot of Canterbury Peter Thomas, Bishop of Constantinople Schottin of Kilkenny Wiltrudis, Abbess of Bergen 7 * Aldric/Elric/Aldericus, Bishop of Le Mans, d856 * Anastasius, Archbishop of Sens d977 * Brannoc(k), Abbot of Braunton * Cedd of Lindisfarne, Bishop of London d664 Charles of Sezze Clerus of Antioch Crispin of Pavia Crispin II of Pavia * Cronan Beg, Bishop in County Down Donnan Edward Waterson Eimhin Emilian of Saujon Felix + Januarius Frambaldus Isidore, martyr Isidore, Bishop of Seville Julian of Cagliari Kanute/Canute Lavard, Duke of Schleswig Kentigerna of Loch Lomond, sister of Comgan, mother of Fillan Lucian of Antioch Nicetas of Remesiana Palladius, Bishop of Embrun Pelagius, Bishop of Embrun * Raymund of Penafort 1175-1275 Rein(h)old of Cologne Sanctinus, Bishop of Senlis Tillo Valentine, Bishop of Passau Vitalis, Abbot of Savigny Wittikund 8 * Albert, Bishop of Cashel, Ireland d800 Amalburga, C8th * Apollinaris the Apologist, Bishop of Hierapolis, Phrygia d c175 * Athelm, Archbishop of Canterbury d923 * Atticus, Bishop of Constantinople d425 Baldwin Cillian Edgar the Peaceable, King of England Ergnada, virgin of Ulster Erhard, Bishop of Regensburg Eugene Fionan Frodbert, Abbot of Troyes Garibaldus, Bishop of Ratisbon Gregory, Bishop of Bulgaria d1012 (Orth) Gudula C8th, Brussels Laurence Lucian, Maximus + Julian Nathalan(us) Bishop of Aberdeenshire, (+ Jan 19) Patiens, Bishop of Metz Pega of Peakirk, sister Guthlac Rigobert, Bishop of Reims Severinus, abbot Severinus, Bishop of Septempeda Thorfinn William, Bishop of York Wulsin, Bishop of Sherbourne 9 * Adrian, Abbot in Canterbury d710 * Brithwald/Brihtwald/Berhtwald/Berthwald/Beretuald Archbishop of Canterbury d c731 Ciaran * Foelanus/FaolanFillan/Felan, Abbot of Strathfillan (+ Jan 19) Honorius Jodocus/Judoc, of Ponthieu (Translation to Winchester) Julian + Basilissa, virgin martyrs Lucianus, Bishop of Beauvais Marciana, virgin, martyr Muiredach d 1088 Paschasia, virgin, martyr Pauline Marie Jaricot Peter of Sebaste Philip of Moscow Waningus Agatho, Pope c577-681 Behrtwald 10 * Dermot/Diarmaid Gregory X, Pope John Camillus Bonus, Bishop of Milan Marcian Nicanor Paul, the first hermit Peter Orseolo/Urseolus Petronius of Avignon, Bishop of St. Dié Polieuctus Sethrida Thomian, Bishop of Armagh Valeric William of Nevers, d1209 Bishop of Bourges 11 * Alexander, Bishop of Fermo c250 Anastasius of Castel Sant'Elia * Boadin the Irishman, hermit in France * Brandan, Irish monk in Gaul C5th Brettiva Earnan Egwin, Bishop of Worcester E(i)thne/Ethenia/Etnenia + Fedelm/Fidelm(i)a, Connaught d433 Failbhe Hono(ra)ta of Pavia Hygin(i)us, Pope Leucius, Bishop of Brindisi Lluwchaiarn, Abbot, C7th, Wales Palaemon Paldo, Tsao + Tato Paulinus, Bishop of Aquileia d804 Peter, Severus + Leucius Quintinus Ronan Salvius, Bishop of Amiens Suibhne Theodosius the Cenobiarc(h) Three Kings (Death) Vitalis of Gaza, C5th-6th William Carter William, Bishop of Bourges 12 Aelred/Ailred of Rievaulx 1110-67 Allan/E(i)lian ab Erbin C6th, Cornwall * Anthony Mary (Eustace) Pucci, Viareggia 1819-92 * Arcadius, martyr, Mauretania * Bartholomew Alvarez, Blessed, Portuguese Jesuit d1737, Japan Bennet/Benedict Biscop, d690, Abbot of Wearmouth * Caesaria, Abbess, sister of Caesarius of Arles C6th Conan Cuimin Forty-Two Martyrs of Ephesus John (of Ravenna), Pope Hilary, Bishop of Poitiers Marguerite Bourgeoys, Canada Martin of Loen Probus of Verona Remigius Salvius Satyrus Tatiana/Tania of Rome, virgin martyr Tigrius + Eutropius Victorian(us) of Asan Zoticus, Rogatus, Modestus, Castulus, Ciriacus + comps 13 * Agricius/Agrecius, Bishop of Trier/Treves d335 * Andrew, Bishop of Trier/Treves d c235 Berno, Abbot of Cluny Colman * Elian/Alan, Breton Missionary in Cornwall C6th Erbin/Hermes, Cornwall Firminus, Bishop of Amiens Forty Soldiers of Rome Glaphya Godfrey, Count of Cappenburg * Hilary, Bishop of Poitiers, 315-68 Ivetta/Yvette * Kentigern/Cyndeyrn/Mung(h)o Bishop of Glasgow, d612 Kessog/Makessog, (+ Mar 10) Mainchin Octave of Epiphany Potitus Remigius, Bishop of Reims Ronan Veronica of Milan 14 * Barbashemin/Barbasymas, Bishop of Seleucia + comps d346 Clementine Datius, Bishop of Milan Felix of Nola c250 Flann Hilary Kentigern Macrina the Elder Martyrs of Mt. Sinai and Raithu Odo of Novaria Pontianus Sava/Saba(s) 1174-1235 (bro Stephen II of Serbia) Alexander Akimetes 'of the Sleepless Ones' C5th, Constantinople 15 Aithche * Arnold Jansen, Blessed, Germany 1837-1909 * Blaithmaic, Abbot of Iona, martyred by Danes d823 * Bonitus/Bonet, Bishop of Clermont C7th Ceolwulf, King, monk of Lindisfarne Emebert, Bishop of Cambrai Ephys(i)us Gabriel of Lesnovo C10-11th (Orth) Isidore, Bishop of Seville Isidore, priest * Ita/Ida/Dorothy of Killeedy, foster-mother of Brendan, d570 John Calybites Llawdoc, C6th monk Lleudadd/Laudatus, Abbot of Bardsey Island Macarius Malard, Bishop of Chartres Maurilius, Bishop of Angers, (Translation) * Maura Maurus, (now Oct 5) Micah, Biblical Paul, the first hermit, mid C2nd Peter of Castelnau Prochoros of Pshina, C11th (Orth) Remedius Saul/Sawl, father of Asaph Secunda Tarsitia/Tarscia of Rodez 16 Cillian Conrad of Mondsee Dacian + comps Damaskinos of Gabrovo, d1771 (Orth) Diarmaid Dunchaid Ó Braoin, Abbot of Clonmacnoise Ferriolus/Ferreolus of Ecija, Bishop of Grenoble Five Friars Minor (Berardus, Peter, Accursius, Adjutus, Otto) d1226 Fulgentius of Lagny Fursey/Furseus of Ireland, Abbot of Burgh Castle and Péronne Gonsalvo/Gundisalvus of Amaranthia Henry of Coquet Island Honoratus, Bishop of Arles Honoratus of Fondi James, Bishop of Tarentaise Jane of Bagno Karentoc Macarius the Elder Maeliosa Marcellus, Pope Mark Melas Priscilla, C1st Sigebert Tatian/Titian + comps Triverius Valerius of Sorrento 17 * Achillas + Amoes, Flowers of the Desert, Egypt * Anthony the Abbot/the Great/of Egypt 251-356 Anthony, Merulus + John Devota, d303, Corsica Earnan Genulf(us), Bishop of Cahors + Genitus Joseph of Freising Julian Sabas the Elder Mildgyth(a)/Milgitha/Myldgytha, Abbess of Minster Nennius, Abbot in Ireland Pior Richimirus Rosaline/Roselina de Villenueve Sabinas, Bishop of Piacenza Speosippus/Speusippus, Sulpicius/Sulpitius II Pius (Severus), Bishop of Bourges Ultan 18 * Ammonius + Moseus c 250, Bithynia Ana/Dana * Archelais, Thecla + Susanna, virgin martyrs, Salerno 293 Christina Ciccarelli Deicolus Dermot, Abbot of Innis-Clotran Ioakeim I, Patriarch of Trnovo d1246 (Orth) Leobard Margaret of Hungary Peter Prisca * Susan(nah), biblical Ulfrid, C11th Venerandus, Bishop of Auvergne Volusian(us), Bishop of Tours 19 Andrew of Peschiera * Arcontius, Bishop of Viviers, martyr C8th/9th * Arsenius, 1st Bishop of Corfu d959 * Bassian(us), Bishop of Lodi, Lombardy d413 Bernard of Corleone Blaithmac/Blaitmaic, Abbot of Iona + comps d825 * Branvalator/ Branwallader/Branwaladr, Bishop of Jersey, C6th (Translation to Milton Abbey) Desiderius, Bishop of Langres, (Translation) Fachtna Fillian/Faolan/Fillan, Abbot of Strathfillan, son of Kentigerna,

Germanicus Henry, Bishop of Uppsala d 1150s Kanute/Canute, King of Denmark Launomar * Marguerite Bourjeoys 1620-1700 Marius, Martha + sons (Audifax + Abachum) Nathalan, Bishop of Aberdeens're (+Jan 8) Patroclus Pontianus Remigius, Bishop of Rouen Suibhne Thomas of Cori Wul(f)stan, Bishop of Worcester d1095 20 Aonghus Benedict Ricasoli Contestus, Bishop of Bayeux Cronan Desiderius, Bishop of Thérouanne * Euthymius the Great, Bishop near Jerusalem C5th Efthymios, Patriarch of Trnovo 1368-1393 * Fabian, Pope Fearghus Fechin/Feichin/Vigean, Abbot of Fore/Fobhar, d 664/5 Mary + Martha Molagga, Abbot of Fermoy * Sebastian Martyr d284, Rome 21 * Agnes, virgin martyr, Rome 291-305 * Alban Bartholomew Roe c1580-1642 * Brigid/Briga of Kilbride, virgin C6th Edward Stransham Epiphanius, Bishop of Pavia Fainche Flann Fructuosus, Bishop of Tarragona, + comps (Augurius + Eulogius) Inez de Beniganim Laudog, Wales Meginrad/Meinrad Nicholas Woodfen Patroclus Winnin/Vimin, Bishop in Scotland 22 * Anastasius/Anastatius (Magundat), Persian martyr d628 * Blaesilla, widow of Rome c360-83 * Brihtwold/Brithwald, Bishop of Ramsbury & Old Sarum d1045 Colman Dominic Epiphanius * Lonan Finn Peter the Holy Martyr (Orth) Siony the Bulgarian (Orth) Ulphus Urban, Pope (Translation) Vincent of Saragossa C3rd-4th Vincent, Orontius + Victor Vincent Pallotti 23 Agilus * Amasius of Greece, Bishop of Teano d356 * Asclas, martyr in Egupt, d287 * Bernard/Barnard, Archbishop of Vienne d841 Boisil/Boswell, Abbot of Maelros/Melrose (+ Jul 7) * Clement of Ancyra + Agathangelus d 309 Coinneach Colman, Bishop of Lismore Ellyw, Wales C6th Emerentiana, d305 Eusebius Ildephonsus, Bishop of Toledo d667 John the Almoner/ Almsgiver, Bishop of Alexandria Lucan Lufthild Macarius Maimbod (of Ireland) Besançon Margaret of Ravenna Raymond of Peñafort Urban, Bishop of Langres Wendreda, virgin, March 24 * Artemius, Bishop of Clermont/Auvergne d396 Autbert, Bishop of Cambrai, (Elevation) * Babylas/Basille, Bishop of Antioch (+ Urban, Prilidian + Epolonius) d c250 * Bertram/Bertrand, Abbot of Saint-Quentin C7th Cadoc, Bishop of Llancarvan Eric, king Felician, Bishop of Foligno Francis de Sales 1567-1622 Gladys Guasacht, Bishop in Ireland Macedonius Macharius Marcolino of Forli Sabinianus Timothy 25 * Amarinus, Bishop of Clermont d676 Aodh * Apollo, hermit, Egypt d c395 Artemas * Bretannion, Bishop of Tomi, Romania d380 Dwyn/Dwyn(w)en of Llandwyn C5th, dau Brychan Eochod, Apostle to Galloway Fursey of Ireland, Abbot of Burgh Castle

Juventinus + Maximinus Paul the Apostle (Conversion) Poppo, Abbot of Stavelot Pr(a)ejectus, Bishop of Clermont Publius Theneva/Thenu/Enoch/Denw, mother of

Theoritgitha of Barking on Thames 26 * Alberic, Abbot of Cîteaux, Cistercian founder, d1109 * Ansurius/Isauri, Bishop of Orense, Galicia d925 * Athanasius, Bishop (of Sorrento) Bathild * Conan, Bishop of Iona and the Isle of Man C7th Eirnin Eystein Julian, Bishop of Le Mans Marus, Bishop of Trier * Paula 247-404 Polycarp * Timothy + Titus C1st Vera 27 * Angela Merici/Mend/of Brescia 1470-1540 * Avitus (Aubrey) martyr of Africa Conan Devota Ethelfleda, Abbess of Romsey (Translation) John Chrysostom, Bishop of Constantinople John of Warneton, Bishop of Thérouanne Julian, Bishop of Le Mans Lidgean, missionary abbot, Ireland C7th Lucan Lupus, Bishop of Chalon-sur-Saône Marius Miren/Muirgen Natalis, Abbot in Ireland Paula of Bethlehem C4th Vitalian, Pope 28 Agnes, (Octave) * Amadeus of Anastasia * Aquilinus, Bavaria, Milan, d650 Bathild(is), Queen of France b630 Constantius Cronan Cyril Flora/Blath, virgin of St Bridget's Kildare d523 Gildas the Wise, Bishop in Brittany d c570 Julian the Hospitaller Paula * Sabina Sabinianus Serena Sulpicius Severus, Bishop of Bourges Valerius, Bishop of Trier Voloc 30 Adelelm(us)/Aleaume/Lesmes, Abbot of Burgos, Spain bFrance d1100 Adelgund(is)/Aldegonda/Aldegun/Aldegunais/Orgonne, Abbess of Mauberge c630-84 Ailbe Alexander, C3rd (Jerusalem) Anatolius, Bishop of Salinis Anne, mother of Mary (Translation) Armentarius, Bishop of Pavia d c451 * Armentarius, Bishop of Antibes, Provence d c711 * Barsamja/Barsimaeus, Bishop of Odessa/Edessa d250 * Bathild(is), wife of Clovis Il d680 Cronan Dimitrios, Martyr of Sliven d1841 (Orth) Eanan Flavian * Francois de Sales * Glascian * Hyacintha Mariscotti * Martina Matthew, Bishop of Jerusalem Peter, King of the Bulgarians 927-969 Polycarp Sebastian Tibbe, virgin of Brecknock 31 Adamnan of Coldingham d680 * Aodh« Athanasius, Bishop of Modon d c885 Bobinus, Bishop of Troyes d766 Coinneach Cyrus + John Eusebius * Felix, Fortunatus + Achilleus, (Translation) * Gaudus, Bishop of Evreux * Geminianus, Bishop of Modena * Hyacinthus Ignatius John (Giovanni) Bosco 1815-88, Italy Julius + Julian Lodivica (Louisa) Albertoni Marcella 325-410, Rome Mark the Evangelist Metrannus
